pt.project1Title: Automa√ß√£o para Segmenta√ß√£o e Padroniza√ß√£o de Entidades
pt.project1ChallengeText: A an√°lise de dados e atualiza√ß√£o de entidades era prejudicada por inconsist√™ncias e falta de um padr√£o nos nomes das entidades, o que exigia um processo de limpeza manual intensivo. Al√©m disso, a valida√ß√£o da autenticidade dessas entidades era um desafio complexo, comprometendo a confiabilidade dos dados para uso estrat√©gico.
pt.project1SolutionText: Projetei e implementei um algoritmo de segmenta√ß√£o em Python, PySpark e SQLSpark, que utiliza uma estrutura de dados Trie como base, al√©m de criar regras especificas para o desafio garantindo a efici√™ncia da segmenta√ß√£o e padroniza√ß√£o das entidades. Al√©m disso, para garantir a veracidade dos resultados, foram elaboradas e aplicadas l√≥gicas que analisam o resultado final em tr√™s etapas diferentes, garantindo maior efici√™ncia e confiabilidade.
pt.project1ResultsText: A solu√ß√£o eliminou 90% do trabalho manual de limpeza e padroniza√ß√£o dos dados. Isso garantiu a automo√ß√£o completa do processo de atualiza√ß√£o de novas entidades e um aumento substancial na confiabilidade e precis√£o dos dados para todas as an√°lises de Rela√ß√µes P√∫blicas.
pt.project1PraQuem: Algoritmo desenvolvido para Cortex Intelligence, enquanto Assistente de Engenharia de Dados.
pt.project2Title: Sistema de Valida√ß√£o de Entidades Jornalisticas com IA
pt.project2ChallengeText: Novas entidades jornalisticas surgiam diariamente e o processo de valida√ß√£o j√° estava ultrapassado e propenso a erros, o que resultava em uma base de jornalistas desatualizada.
pt.project2SolutionText: Em colabora√ß√£o com a equipe de Ci√™ncia de Dados, criei um sistema que primeiro classificava entidades como 'Novas' ou 'Existentes' usando Spark. Para as 'Novas', utilizei a API da OPENAI para realizar uma verifica√ß√£o de validade externa, confirmando e enriquecendo os registros.
pt.project2ResultsText: Cria√ß√£o de uma fonte de dados confi√°vel e sempre atualizada, automa√ß√£o completa do processo de pesquisa e valida√ß√£o, e melhora na efici√™ncia das campanhas de Rela√ß√µes P√∫blicas.
pt.project2PraQuem: Desenvolvido para Cortex Intelligence, enquanto Assistente de Engenharia de Dados.
pt.project3ChallengeText: A geocodifica√ß√£o de entidades era feita manualmente, o que resultava em erros frequentes, inconsist√™ncias dos dados e aus√™ncia de informa√ß√µes geogr√°ficas essenciais para a equipe de Rela√ß√µes P√∫blicas.
pt.project3SolutionText: Desenvolvi e implementei um algoritmo de geocodifica√ß√£o customizada, atrav√©s da ferramenta GeoPy, que processa os nomes das entidades e retorna sua localiza√ß√£o a n√≠vel de cidade, estado e pa√≠s. O algoritimo foi projetado para encontrar a localiza√ß√£o mais precisa e atualizar automaticamente a entidade no banco de dados.
pt.project3ResultsText: O algoritmo alcan√ßou uma taxa de acerto de 40%na geocodifica√ß√£o das entidades, garantindo o preenchimento correto e completo de grande parte das entidades e melhorando a precis√£o dos dados de localiza√ß√£o, eliminando erros manuais. Al√©m disso, a automa√ß√£o do processo de geocodifica√ß√£o reduziu significativamente o tempo gasto pela equipe de Rela√ß√µes P√∫blicas na atualiza√ß√£o de dados geogr√°ficos.
pt.project3PraQuem: Desenvolvido para Cortex Intelligence, enquanto Assistente de Engenharia de Dados.
pt.contactTitle: Me fale sobre o seu projeto
pt.contactDesc1: Todo projeto tem um problema a ser resolvido. Se voc√™ tem um desafio, eu posso programar a solu√ß√£o.

en.pageTitle: Machine Learning & Computational Social Science - Gabrielly Gomes üß©
en.heroDescription: I'm a Data and Machine Learning engineer, crafting innovative solutions at the intersection of technology, society, and accessibility
en.cvExp1Desc1: I drive data-driven innovation in Cortex's Public Relations (PR) team, transforming raw data into strategic insights that enhance brand reputation and stakeholder engagement.
en.cvExp1Desc2: Developed automated data collection pipelines, reducing manual data collection time by 70%.
en.cvExp1Desc3: Developed and implemented the automated entity word segmentation algorithm using advanced Trie techniques to standardize and clean data, reducing manual cleaning by 90% and automating data updates.
en.cvExp1Desc4: Collaborated with the Data Science team to build an AI-powered entity validation system, using the GPT API to ensure data reliability.
en.cvExp1Desc5: Developed and implemented the entity geocoding algorithm, ensuring that 40% of entities were correctly geocoded, improving the accuracy of location data.
en.cvExp1ferramentas: Tools and Languages: Databricks, AWS, Postman, Python, Spark, SQL, SQLSpark, Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter Notebook
en.cvExp2Desc1: Led, designed, and developed CurupiraIA, a Machine Learning model for detecting hate speech in Portuguese in social media comments.
en.cvExp2Desc2: Used the BERTimbau architecture for model training, working with a dataset of 43,668 classified comments.
en.cvExp2Desc3: To handle class imbalance, I implemented dropout techniques in training and optimized the process with a learning rate of 2e-5 and a batch size of 32.
en.cvExp2Desc4: The model achieved an accuracy of 81.68%, outperforming the majority class by 10.42%. F1-macro and F1-micro results were balanced, ranging from 61% to 64%.
en.cvExp2Desc5: The model reached 89% precision for the Aggressive-Hate class and 92% precision for the Non-Aggressive class, and demonstrated high efficiency by processing 72.36 samples per second.
en.cvExp2ferramentas: Tools and Languages: Python, Jupyter Notebook, Transformers

en.cvEdu1Detalhes2: Ranked 45th, among 676 submissions, in the 1st Agentic AI Innovation Challenge (2025) for a technical paper on AI for audiovisual accessibility, published in Ready Tensor Inc. magazine.
en.cvEdu1Detalhes3: Selected among the top 20 papers, out of more than 50, at ENUCOMPI 2025, where I presented and published a scientific paper on data-driven analysis of drinking water gaps in Northeast Brazil.
en.cvEdu1Detalhes4: Developed and taught a 20-hour extension course on the use of Data and AI for social impact, training over 60 students.
en.cvEdu1Courses: Relevant Coursework: Machine Learning, Data Analysis, Descriptive Statistics, Mathematics and Logic, Artificial Intelligence, Data Structures, Databases, Big Data, Python Programming

en.cvProgram2Desc4: Digital transformation, AI's societal impact, and strategies for solving global community challenges.
en.cvProgram2Desc5: Trust-building and designing scalable solutions for local/global issues.
en.cvProgram2Desc6: Engaged in live sessions with world-renowned educators and industry leaders.
en.cvProgram2Desc7: Collaborated with peers from 100+ countries in synchronous discussions, fostering a global perspective on leadership and inclusive problem-solving.

en.servicesTitle: What I can do for you
en.service2Desc: I develop and manage robust and scalable data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data collection, processing, and availability to support analytics and machine learning applications.
en.service3Desc: I design, build, and deploy end-to-end Machine Learning systems, handling everything from model conception to monitoring and maintenance in production environments, ensuring performance and scalability.
en.service3Cta: üí° Ready to take your ML models to production?
en.service4Desc: I use data and computational tools to understand social structures and behaviors. Focusing on a critical and social perspective, I apply technologies like AI to analyze social phenomena and promote reflections on their use and ethical implications, transforming data into an understanding of social reality.
en.service4Cta: üåç Let's understand and transform society with data?
en.course1Title: Ethical and social behaviors: exploring the potential of data and AI
en.course1SummaryContent: This course explores how data and Artificial Intelligence can be used to analyze social phenomena, promoting critical reflection on their ethical implications. Aimed at Data Management students at UFPI and the general public, with a workload of 20 hours.
en.course1Meeting1Title: Digital Traces: Dialogues between Data, Society and You (Gabrielly A. Gomes, coming soon)
en.project1TitleEn: Automation for Entity Segmentation and Standardization
en.project1ChallengeTextEn: Data analysis and entity updates were hampered by inconsistencies and the lack of a standard in entity names, which required an intensive manual cleaning process. Furthermore, validating the authenticity of these entities was a complex challenge, compromising the reliability of the data for strategic use.
en.project1SolutionTextEn: I designed and implemented a segmentation algorithm in Python, PySpark, and SQLSpark, which uses a Trie data structure as a base, along with creating specific rules for the challenge, ensuring the efficiency of entity segmentation and standardization. Additionally, to ensure the veracity of the results, logic was developed and applied to analyze the final result in three different stages, guaranteeing greater efficiency and reliability.
en.project1ResultsTextEn: The solution eliminated 90% of the manual work of data cleaning and standardization. This ensured the complete automation of the process of updating new entities and a substantial increase in the reliability and accuracy of the data for all Public Relations analyses.
en.project1PraQuemEn: Algorithm developed for Cortex Intelligence, as a Data Engineering Assistant.
en.project2ChallengeTextEn: New journalistic entities emerged daily, and the validation process was outdated and prone to errors, resulting in an outdated journalist database.
en.project2SolutionTextEn: In collaboration with the Data Science team, I created a system that first classified entities as 'New' or 'Existing' using Spark. For the 'New' ones, I used the OPENAI API to perform an external validity check, confirming and enriching the records.
en.project2ResultsTextEn: Creation of a reliable and always-updated data source, complete automation of the research and validation process, and improvement in the efficiency of Public Relations campaigns.
en.project2PraQuemEn: Developed for Cortex Intelligence, as a Data Engineering Assistant.
en.project3ChallengeTextEn: The geocoding of entities was done manually, which resulted in frequent errors, data inconsistencies, and the absence of essential geographical information for the Public Relations team.
en.project3SolutionTextEn: I developed and implemented a custom geocoding algorithm, using the GeoPy tool, which processes entity names and returns their location at the city, state, and country level. The algorithm was designed to find the most accurate location and automatically update the entity in the database.
en.project3ResultsTextEn: The algorithm achieved a 40% success rate in geocoding entities, ensuring the correct and complete filling of a large part of the entities and improving the accuracy of location data, eliminating manual errors. Furthermore, the automation of the geocoding process significantly reduced the time spent by the Public Relations team on updating geographic data.
en.project3PraQuemEn: Developed for Cortex Intelligence, as a Data Engineering Assistant.
en.contactDesc1: Every project has a problem to solve. If you have a challenge, I can code the solution.
en.contactDesc2: After you reach out, I‚Äôll respond within 2-3 business days with either an initial project estimate or follow-up questions to understand your needs better.
